headline.main: In the Latest Turn for Harry Potter and Company, Letting All the ‘What Ifs’ Out to Play

docs.snippet: True to the expansive spirit of the fantasy series’s multifaceted universe, “Harry Potter and the Cursed Child” is a collaboration among J.K. Rowling, the playwright Jack Thorne and the director John Tiffany....

headline.main: Former L.A. County Sheriff Indicted on New Federal Charges
headline.print_headline: Former L.A. County Sheriff Indicted on New Federal Charges

docs.snippet: Former Los Angeles County Sheriff Lee Baca, who earlier this week withdrew his guilty plea to a charge of lying to federal investigators in a corruption probe, was indicted on Friday on three new criminal counts, prosecutors said....
docs.lead_paragraph: Former Los Angeles County Sheriff Lee Baca, who earlier this week withdrew his guilty plea to a charge of lying to federal investigators in a corruption probe, was indicted on Friday on three new criminal counts, prosecutors said.

headline.main: UN Report: All Sides Violate Humanitarian Law in Yemen
headline.print_headline: UN Report: All Sides Violate Humanitarian Law in Yemen

docs.snippet: All sides in Yemen's 17-month old civil war have committed violations of international humanitarian law, according to a new United Nations report that will be used to determine if further sanctions should be applied in the conflict....
docs.lead_paragraph: All sides in Yemen's 17-month old civil war have committed violations of international humanitarian law, according to a new United Nations report that will be used to determine if further sanctions should be applied in the conflict.

headline.main: Court: Former Maine Hermit Doesn't Owe State Police Money
headline.print_headline: Court: Former Maine Hermit Doesn't Owe State Police Money

docs.lead_paragraph: Maine's highest court has ruled that a man who lived as a hermit in the woods for nearly three decades won't have to pay restitution to state police.

headline.main: Jamaican Discus Thrower Morgan Loses Appeal to Compete in Rio
headline.print_headline: Jamaican Discus Thrower Morgan Loses Appeal to Compete in Rio

docs.snippet: Jamaican discus thrower Jason Morgan has lost his appeal over being excluded from their Olympics team despite having reached the qualifying standard, the top sport court ruled on Friday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Jamaican discus thrower Jason Morgan has lost his appeal over being excluded from their Olympics team despite having reached the qualifying standard, the top sport court ruled on Friday.
